decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to ramp quickly with mana-producing creatures and spells to bring out high-impact threats like Craterhoof Behemoth and Primeval Titan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive start, using cards like Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary to accelerate its mana production and cards like Scapeshift to put a significant number of lands into play. Additionally, it includes utility cards like Ghost Quarter and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and cards like Sylvan Safekeeper to protect its key creatures. By efficiently ramping and playing powerful threats, the deck seeks to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering opponents' spells, disrupting their strategies, and managing the board with removal spells. The commander, Narset, Enlightened Master, allows players to cast non-creature spells for free when attacking, enabling the deck to take advantage of powerful sorceries and instants. The deck includes a variety of counterspells, card draw spells, and removal spells to control the game and protect Narset. Additionally, the deck includes extra turn spells to generate card advantage and tempo, as well as planeswalkers to provide additional utility and win conditions. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting its spells.

The main concept of this Animar, Soul of Elements deck is to quickly assemble a combo by reducing the cost of creatures with +1/+1 counters on Animar. By using cards like Cloudstone Curio, Ancestral Statue, and Peregrine Drake, the deck aims to generate infinite mana and/or creature casts to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes various card draw engines like Skullclamp and Mulldrifter to maintain card advantage. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful creatures like Kozilek, Butcher of Truth and Primeval Titan to further strengthen its board presence. Overall, the deck focuses on efficiently ramping, comboing off, and overwhelming opponents with a combination of strong creatures and synergistic card interactions.

The deck revolves around utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own resources. It focuses on countering spells, bouncing permanents, and destroying threats while also generating card advantage through powerful draw spells. The deck includes a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and hand disruption to control the board and keep the opponent on the back foot. It also features powerful planeswalkers and creatures that provide additional value and pressure the opponent. The mana base is designed to support casting spells efficiently and consistently, with a mix of blue and black sources. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game and grind out incremental advantages to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence with efficient creatures. The deck combines aggressive creatures like Silverblade Paladin and Voice of Resurgence with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach to keep the opponent off balance. Additionally, powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay are included to deal with any threats the opponent may present. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Sorin, Lord of Innistrad and Liliana of the Veil to provide additional utility and leverage the board advantage. Overall, the strategy is to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure victory.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game through a combination of board wipes, artifact disruption, and resource denial. By using cards like Ruination, Vandalblast, Wasteland, and Tectonic Edge, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up its own resources with cards like Solemn Simulacrum and Wurmcoil Engine. Daretti, Scrap Savant's abilities allow for recursion and card advantage, further enhancing the control elements of the deck. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's board state, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast the opponent, eventually winning through either incremental advantage or a large threat like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful graveyard-based combo using Sidisi, Undead Vizier to tutor key pieces. It includes a variety of mana acceleration and card draw to quickly find combo pieces like Necrotic Ooze, Phyrexian Devourer, and Triskelion. The deck also includes powerful disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Hymn to Tourach to control the game. Alongside a toolbox of removal spells and board wipes, the deck can quickly disrupt opponents' strategies while setting up its own win condition. The goal is to efficiently combo off and win the game through graveyard recursion or overwhelming opponents with a powerful board presence.

The deck revolves around using control elements, such as counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption, to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain an advantage. It also includes cards that generate card advantage, such as Ancestral Vision and Phyrexian Arena, to ensure a steady stream of resources. The commander, Wydwen, the Biting Gale, provides a flexible and evasive threat that can pressure the opponent while also providing protection. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently answering threats and generating incremental advantages over time. It includes a mix of permission spells, card draw, removal, and proactive threats to control the pace of the game and ultimately emerge victorious.
